unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies See Increased Uptake in Maharashtra**
normalised: **energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies see increased uptake in maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) reports a significant rise in the adoption of rooftop solar power following the implementation of revised subsidy schemes. The state government offers subsidies of up to 40% for systems up to 3 kW capacity, and 20% for systems between 3 kW and 10 kW.
normalised: mumbai, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – maharashtra state electricity distribution company limited (MSEDCL) reports a significant rise in the adoption of rooftop solar power following the implementation of revised subsidy schemes. the state government offers subsidies of up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt capacity, and twenty percent for systems between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt.

unnormalised: Dr. Anil Sharma, Energy Secretary, highlighted that over 5,000 households in Pune alone have availed the subsidies in the last quarter. The average rooftop system size installed is around 500 sq ft.
normalised: doctor anil sharma, energy secretary, highlighted that over five thousand households in pune alone have availed the subsidies in the last quarter. the average rooftop system size installed is around five hundred square feet.

unnormalised: "We aim to promote sustainable energy practices and reduce dependence on conventional power sources," stated Dr. Sharma. The subsidy program has been extended to March 31, 2024. Consumers can expect a return on investment within 5-7 years, saving Rs. 20,000-30,000 annually on electricity bills. Further incentives are being considered for housing societies investing in community solar projects. The initiative is part of the larger National Solar Mission.
